frontmatter.title: LeetCode 105. Construct Binary Tree from Preoder and Inorder Traversal

previous.body:
This took me a few days although it's only a medium! It is important to remember Python is pass-by-reference.
I spent a lot of time debugging because I didn't mirror changes between previous and next nodes when moving a node between them.
I was able to debug by creating a list of key-value pairs then printing the list after each operation.


___

# Solution
```python
class Node:
    def __init__(self, key=0, val=0, prev=None, next=None):
        self.key = key
        self.val = val
        self.prev = prev
        self.next = next

class LRUCache:
    def __init__(self, capacity: int):
        self.capacity = capacity
        self.size = 0
        self.d = {}
        self.l = None
        self.start = None

    def get(self, key: int) -> int:
        if key in self.d:
            node = self.d[key]
            if node.prev and node.next:
                node.prev.next = node.next
                node.next.prev = node.prev
            elif node.next:
                self.start = node.next
                self.start.prev = None
            if self.l != node:
                node.prev = self.l
                self.l.next = node
                self.l = self.l.next
                self.l.next = None
            return node.val
        else:
            return -1

    def put(self, key: int, value: int) -> None:
        if not key in self.d:
            if self.size == self.capacity:
                node = self.start
                del self.d[node.key]
                self.start = node.next
                if self.start:
                    self.start.prev = None
                self.size -= 1
            if self.l:
                self.l.next = Node(key, value, self.l)
                self.l = self.l.next
            if not self.start:
                self.start = Node(key, value)
                self.l = self.start
            self.d[key] = self.l
            self.size += 1
        else:
            node = self.d[key]
            if node == self.start and self.start.next:
                self.start = self.start.next
                self.start.prev = None
            if node.prev and node.next:
                node.prev.next = node.next
                node.next.prev = node.prev
            if node != self.l:
                node.prev = self.l
                self.l.next = node
            node.val = value
            node.next = None
            self.l = node



# Your LRUCache object will be instantiated and called as such:
# obj = LRUCache(capacity)
# param_1 = obj.get(key)
# obj.put(key,value)
```
Time complexity for get and put operations are O(n) = 1 and space complexity is O(n) due to the dictionary holding each element.

frontmatter.title: LeetCode 236. Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Tree

next.body:
This is the last month of my goal toward 150 problems done by 2025. I'll have to pick up more than a few problems this weekend. I have 56 problems remaining.

___

# Solution
```python
from collections import deque

# Definition for a binary tree node.
# class TreeNode:
#     def __init__(self, x):
#         self.val = x
#         self.left = None
#         self.right = None

class Solution:
    def lowestCommonAncestor(self, root: 'TreeNode', p: 'TreeNode', q: 'TreeNode') -> 'TreeNode':
        if root in (None, p, q): return root
        left, right = [self.lowestCommonAncestor(kid, p, q) for kid in (root.left, root.right)]
        return root if left and right else left or right
            

```
Time complexity is O(n) = n and space complexity is O(h) where the height is h. Best case the height is log(n) as a balanced tree and worst case is n as a skewed tree.

frontmatter.title: LeetCode 105. Construct Binary Tree from Preoder and Inorder Traversal

post.body:
Happy Thanksgiving! I am happy to have solved this without looking up a solution. However, I did have to review traversals.

___

# Solution
```python
from collections import deque

# Definition for a binary tree node.
# class TreeNode:
#     def __init__(self, val=0, left=None, right=None):
#         self.val = val
#         self.left = left
#         self.right = right
class Solution:
    def buildTree(self, preorder: List[int], inorder: List[int]) -> Optional[TreeNode]:
        top = deque(preorder)
        bottom = deque(inorder)
        nodes = []
        seen = set()

        root = parent = TreeNode()
        while top:
            parent.right = TreeNode(top.popleft())
            left = parent.right
            seen.add(left.val)
            nodes.append(left)
            while left.val != bottom[0]:
                left.left = TreeNode(top.popleft())
                left = left.left
                seen.add(left.val)
                nodes.append(left)
            while bottom and bottom[0] in seen:
                bottom.popleft()
                parent = nodes.pop()
            
        return root.right
```
Time complexity is O(n) = n and space complexity is O(n) due to set and deques.
